IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE CARE AND SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY IN THE COLUMBIA HEIGHTS COMMUNIty.
IRS990.MissionDescription: to serve people by offering a continuum of quality care and services and by providing for their spiritual, emotional and physical needs.
IRS990.Description: crest view lutheran home: 122 BED NURSING HOME facility FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED. For fiscal year ended september 30, 2010 total occupancy was 95.2%. The Nursing Facility provides health care treatment and convalescent facilities to in-patient seniors and disabled individuals, including those admitted as an interim step, after hospitalization and before returning to their homes, as well as those admitted for long-term residency.Nursing Facility residents receive room and board, 24-hour professional nursing care, and special diets as required. The care center participates in a five meal per day plan, either in his or her room or at the central dining location. There are social and recreational programs and spiritual programs. Additional services, such as access to a variety of medical specialists, such drugs and therapies as may be prescribed by the residents physician, telephone, and beauty/barber services are available to the residents at an additional charge. There are two specialty areas within the Nursing Facility. The dementia care area is a 26-bed unit that is being renovated and has a program specific to people with dementia. The rehab care area is 20 beds and is designated for people who we serve on a short-term basis before returning to the place they "call home". The rehab beds are equipped with telephone and cable television service.

Activity2.Description: assisted living: royce place - 50 unit board and lodging facility with special services for the elderly with CAPACITY FOR 64 suites. For fiscal year ended september 30, 2010 total occupancy was 57.7%A variety of services are made available to residents to the Assisted Living Facility, in many cases through programs and facilities made available through other buildings situated on the Corporation's campus. The following services and facilities are provided without an additional charge beyond the regular monthly rental charge: all utilities except telephone, 24 hour staff, routine maintenance, lawn and grounds care, administrative services, social and recreational programs, spiritual care services, exercise machines, a whirlpool tub, a craft room, outdoor gardens and walking paths, scheduled transportation, weekly housekeeping, weekly flat linen service, and three meals per day.The following services and facilities are provided at an additional charge: home health care services, beauty shop services, urgency response to pull cords, and additional supportive services beyond the basic package of services. The Assisted Living Facility's walkout garden level houses a Headstart program providing intergenerational opportunities throughout the Crest View Senior Community on Reservoir Boulevard. The Headstart program leases space and is sponsored by Anoka County Community Action Program, a not-for-profit organization.Crest View on 42nd - 50 unit assisted living facility for the elderly with capacity for 63; includes memory care units. For fiscal year ended September 30, 2010 TOTAL OCCUPANCY = 83.33%The following services and facilities are provided at an additional charge: home health care services, beauty shop services, urgency response to lifeline system, and additional supportive services beyond the basic package of services.The Assisted Living and Memory Care Facility is a three-story building. The building includes laundry facilities, a dining room and private dining room, a home care office, a small library, a large community room that includes a beauty shop, an activities kitchen and a worship area. The total square footage of the building is 40,527 square feet. The Assisted Living and Memory Care Facility first opened for occupancy in 2002. Crest View on 42nd is an Elderly Housing and Services Establishment, registered with the State of Minnesota.On December 20, 2002, Crest View Home Health Care, the Class A (Medicare certified agency) was granted a certificate of assumed name by the State of Minnesota. Crest View Home Health Care provides Medicare certified and skilled home health care services to the community and the crest view campuses.

Activity3.Description: THE BOULEVARD: 74 UNIT SENIOR HOUSING FACILITY FOR THE ELDERY. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30,2010 TOTAL OCCUPANCY WAS 59.9%.A variety of services are made available to residents at the Market Rate Senior Housing Facility, in many cases through programs and facilities made available through other buildings situated on the Corporation's campus. The following services and facilities are provided without additional charge beyond the regular monthly rental charge: all utilities except telephone and electricity, security entrance to building, routine maintenance, lawn and grounds care, outdoor garden area and walking paths, administrative services, social and recreational programs, spiritual care services, library, and scheduled transportation to local stores.The following services and facilities are provided at an additional charge: lunch and dinner in the dining room, urgency response to pull cords, laundry services, underground parking, housekeeping services, home health care services, beauty shop services, and a convenience store.

ActivityOther.Description: CREST VIEW HOME CARE - PROVIDES ASSISTED LIVING HOME HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO REGISTERED HOUSING WITH SERVICES BUILDINGS ON THE CREST VIEW CAMPUSES.
Management Services - Provides management and employee services to Crest View entities

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE CORPORATION HOLDS, IN TRUST, FUNDS ADVANCED BY RESIDENTS OF CREST VIEW LUTHERAN HOME TO BE USED AT EACH RESIDENT'S DISCRETION. THE FUNDS ARE MAINTAINED IN A SEPARATE INTEREST-BEARING SAVINGS ACCOUNT AND THE CORPORATION HAS A FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THESE FUNDS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CORPORATION SHALL HAVE ONE CLASS OF MEMBERS: CHRISTIAN CONGREGATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH MEMBER CONGREGATION HAS ONE VOTE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Decisions are subject to the approval of all members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 FORM IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM AND THE DRAFT FORM IS FORWARDED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S MANAGEMENT FOR REVIEW. A COPY OF FORM FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THE BOARD MEMBERS, DIRECTORS, AND OFFICERS TO DISCLOSE CONFLICTS TO THE ORGANIZATION WHEN THEY ARISE. DIRECTOR MUST DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST ON ANY MATTER TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO ANY ACTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL EMPLOYEES GET the same amount of increase as directed by the State. The Board REVIEWS AND approves all annual compensation at budget approval time. THE LAST REVIEW FOR CEO AND CFO WAS PERFORMED IN 2010.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990 , Part VI, Section A, Line 1
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS COMPOSED OF THE CHAIR, VICE-CHAIR, TREASURER, AND SECRETARY OF THE BOARD. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY ACT DURING INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND ON MATTERS THAT NEED ACTION PRIOR TO THE REGULAR BOARD MEETING WHEN A SPECIAL MEETING OF THE BOARD CANNOT BE TIMELY CONVENED FOR ACTION, AND ON MATTERS FOR WHICH FULL BOARD DELIBERATION AND ACTION IS DEEMED NOT ESSENTIAL. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY PROVIDE DIRECTION AND CONSULTATION TO THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER REGARDING BOARD POLICIES AND CORPORATE ACTION. DURING SUCH INTERVALS AND SUBJECT TO SUCH CONTROL AND DIRECTION, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND MAY EXERCISE ALL OF THE AUTHORITY AND POWERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REGARDING THE BUSINESS AND AFFAIRS OF THE CORPORATION, SUBJECT TO SUCH LIMITATIONS AS THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY IMPOSE FROM TIME TO TIME. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE,IN ACCORDANCE WITH POLICY AND EFFECTIVE BOARD DELIBERATION AND ACTION, MAY DELIBERATE REGARDING MATTERS TO COME BEFORE COMMITTEES AND BY RESOLUTION MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD REGARDING PENDING BOARD ACTION ON SUCH ISSUES.
